targets.legendFormat: System - Processes executing in kernel mode
User - Normal processes executing in user mode
Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode
Idle - Waiting for something to happen
Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete
Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment
Guest - Time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system
System - Processes executing in kernel mode

panels.title: System - Processes executing in kernel mode

targets.legendFormat: Iowait - Waiting for I/O to complete

targets.legendFormat: Idle - Waiting for something to happen

panels.title: Idle - Waiting for something to happen

targets.legendFormat: Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment

panels.title: Steal - Time spent in other operating systems when running in a virtualized environment

targets.legendFormat: Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode

panels.title: Nice - Niced processes executing in user mode

targets.legendFormat: Guest - Time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system

panels.title: Guest - Time spent running a virtual CPU for a guest operating system

targets.legendFormat: Apps - Memory used by user-space applications

panels.title: Apps - Memory used by user-space applications

targets.legendFormat: PageTables - Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses

panels.title: PageTables - Memory used to map between virtual and physical memory addresses

targets.legendFormat: SwapCache - Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified

panels.title: SwapCache - Memory that keeps track of pages that have been fetched from swap but not yet been modified

targets.legendFormat: Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc)

panels.title: Slab - Memory used by the kernel to cache data structures for its own use (caches like inode, dentry, etc)

targets.legendFormat: Cache - Parked file data (file content) cache

panels.title: Cache - Parked file data (file content) cache

targets.legendFormat: Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

panels.title: Harware Corrupted - Amount of RAM that the kernel identified as corrupted / not working

targets.legendFormat: Inactive - Memory which has been less recently used. It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes

panels.title: Inactive - Memory which has been less recently used. It is more eligible to be reclaimed for other purposes

targets.legendFormat: Active - Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary

panels.title: Active - Memory that has been used more recently and usually not reclaimed unless absolutely necessary

targets.legendFormat: Committed_AS - Amount of memory presently allocated on the system

panels.title: Committed_AS - Amount of memory presently allocated on the system

targets.legendFormat: CommitLimit - Amount of memory currently available to be allocated on the system

panels.title: CommitLimit - Amount of memory currently available to be allocated on the system

targets.legendFormat: Inactive_file - File-backed memory on inactive LRU list

panels.title: Inactive_file - File-backed memory on inactive LRU list

targets.legendFormat: Inactive_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on inactive LRU list, including tmpfs (shmem)

panels.title: Inactive_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on inactive LRU list, including tmpfs (shmem)

targets.legendFormat: Active_file - File-backed memory on active LRU list

panels.title: Active_file - File-backed memory on active LRU list

targets.legendFormat: Active_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on active least-recently-used (LRU) list, including tmpfs

panels.title: Active_anon - Anonymous and swap cache on active least-recently-used (LRU) list, including tmpfs

targets.legendFormat: Writeback - Memory which is actively being written back to disk

panels.title: Writeback - Memory which is actively being written back to disk

targets.legendFormat: WritebackTmp - Memory used by FUSE for temporary writeback buffers

panels.title: WritebackTmp - Memory used by FUSE for temporary writeback buffers

targets.legendFormat: Dirty - Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk

panels.title: Dirty - Memory which is waiting to get written back to the disk

targets.legendFormat: Mapped - Used memory in mapped pages files which have been mmaped, such as libraries

panels.title: Mapped - Used memory in mapped pages files which have been mmaped, such as libraries

targets.legendFormat: Shmem - Used shared memory (shared between several processes, thus including RAM disks)

panels.title: Shmem - Used shared memory (shared between several processes, thus including RAM disks)

targets.legendFormat: SUnreclaim - Part of Slab, that cannot be reclaimed on memory pressure

panels.title: SUnreclaim - Part of Slab, that cannot be reclaimed on memory pressure

targets.legendFormat: SReclaimable - Part of Slab, that might be reclaimed, such as caches

panels.title: SReclaimable - Part of Slab, that might be reclaimed, such as caches

targets.legendFormat: VmallocChunk - Largest contigious block of vmalloc area which is free

panels.title: VmallocChunk - Largest contigious block of vmalloc area which is free

targets.legendFormat: VmallocTotal - Total size of vmalloc memory area

panels.title: VmallocTotal - Total size of vmalloc memory area

targets.legendFormat: VmallocUsed - Amount of vmalloc area which is used

panels.title: VmallocUsed - Amount of vmalloc area which is used

targets.legendFormat: Bounce - Memory used for block device bounce buffers

panels.title: Bounce - Memory used for block device bounce buffers

targets.legendFormat: AnonHugePages - Memory in anonymous huge pages

panels.title: AnonHugePages - Memory in anonymous huge pages

targets.legendFormat: AnonPages - Memory in user pages not backed by files

panels.title: AnonPages - Memory in user pages not backed by files

targets.legendFormat: KernelStack - Kernel memory stack. This is not reclaimable

panels.title: KernelStack - Kernel memory stack. This is not reclaimable

targets.legendFormat: HugePages_Free - Huge pages in the pool that are not yet allocated

panels.title: HugePages_Free - Huge pages in the pool that are not yet allocated

targets.legendFormat: HugePages_Rsvd - Huge pages for which a commitment to allocate from the pool has been made, but no allocation has yet been made

panels.title: HugePages_Rsvd - Huge pages for which a commitment to allocate from the pool has been made, but no allocation has yet been made

targets.legendFormat: HugePages_Surp - Huge pages in the pool above the value in /proc/sys/vm/nr_hugepages

panels.title: HugePages_Surp - Huge pages in the pool above the value in /proc/sys/vm/nr_hugepages

targets.legendFormat: HugePages - Total size of the pool of huge pages

panels.title: HugePages - Total size of the pool of huge pages

targets.legendFormat: DirectMap1G - Amount of pages mapped as this size

panels.title: DirectMap1G - Amount of pages mapped as this size

targets.legendFormat: DirectMap2M - Amount of pages mapped as this size

panels.title: DirectMap2M - Amount of pages mapped as this size

targets.legendFormat: DirectMap4K - Amount of pages mapped as this size

panels.title: DirectMap4K - Amount of pages mapped as this size

targets.legendFormat: Unevictable - Amount of unevictable memory that can't be swapped out for a variety of reasons

panels.title: Unevictable - Amount of unevictable memory that can't be swapped out for a variety of reasons

targets.legendFormat: "MLocked - Size of pages locked to memory using the mlock() system call"

panels.title: "MLocked - Size of pages locked to memory using the mlock() system call"

targets.legendFormat: NFS Unstable - Memory in NFS pages sent to the server, but not yet commited to the storage

panels.title: NFS Unstable - Memory in NFS pages sent to the server, but not yet commited to the storage

targets.legendFormat: TCP_inuse - Tcp sockets currently in use

panels.title: TCP_inuse - Tcp sockets currently in use

targets.legendFormat: UDPLITE_inuse - Udplite sockets currently in use

panels.title: UDPLITE_inuse - Udplite sockets currently in use

targets.legendFormat: UDP_inuse - Udp sockets currently in use

panels.title: UDP_inuse - Udp sockets currently in use

targets.legendFormat: FRAG_inuse - Frag sockets currently in use
